{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3538327,"name":"Emmett Sisson","username":"emmettds","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/e/13edae/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-24T18:31:20.790Z","cooked":"

Apologies if this question has already been asked and/or answered, but I’m hoping for some additional clarification beyond what I’ve seen on here.

We’re running our elevator (stock ThriftyBot kit) off an X60, but we’re a little confused on how to get the relative encoder information into our code. We don’t have a CANcoder or any other CTRE products. My main question is this: is there a separate item (like the CANcoder or something else from CTRE) that is required to read the relative encoder from the Kraken? Or is it simply programming that can be implemented using solely the motor’s encoder?

If the first is the case and something needs to be purchased, would a sufficient alternative be to use a REV Through Bore Encoder on the other end of the 1/2" hex shaft, or would that not be accurate enough for setting the elevator to specific heights?

I’m not the most experienced in FRC so I’m sorry if this made absolutely no sense or is easily answerable elsewhere. Thank you for any help or information that can be sent my way!!

Just programming is needed to get the relative encoder information. i think its something like getEncoderPosition() or getPostion() from the motor object
